snippet: At the trial to select the U.S. open team for the World Mind Sports Games in August, the 120-board quarterfinals were played on Tuesday and Wednesday.
abstract: Phillip Alder Bridge column on a deal played in the trial to select the United States open team for the World Mind Sports Games. Diagram (M)
lead_paragraph: At the trial to select the United States open team for the World Mind Sports Games in August, the 120-board quarterfinals were played on Tuesday and Wednesday. At the halfway stage these were the scores by captains' names: Warren Spector 153 international match points, Nick Nickell 95; John Diamond 128, George Jacobs, 112; Roger Lee 121, Martin Fleisher 101; and Reese Milner 99, Jim Mahaffey 90. The final results can be found at usbf.org. Play in the semifinals (Thursday and Friday) and final (Saturday and Sunday) can be watched live at bridgebase.com starting at 11 a.m. Eastern Time. In the previous round only one match was really close. With 30 boards to be played, Lee-Nikolay Demirev and Steve Garner-Howard Weinstein led Steve Robinson-Peter Boyd, Mark Feldman-Bill Pollack and Fred Stewart-Kit Woolsey by 8 imps. But Lee gained 14 imps and 3 imps in the last two sessions to win by 258 imps to 233.
